alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 7:45PM PDT until August 20 at 8:30PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 943 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 943 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 745 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oceanside, Carlsbad, Temecula, Vista, Ramona, Valley Center, Fallbrook, eastern Camp Pendleton, Escondido and San Marcos. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
